concept.title: Offset Column and Offset Value
concept.shortdesc: JDBC Consumer uses an offset column and initial offset value to determine where to start reading data within a table. Ideally, the offset column is a column in the table with unique values. The initial offset value is a value within the offset column where you want JDBC Consumer to start reading.

conbody.p: When you configure the SQL query for the JDBC Consumer, you use the offset column and offset value in a WHERE clause that specifies the data to be read. Use "${offset}" to represent the offset value, for example: SELECT * from <table> WHERE <offset column> > ${offset}

JDBC Consumer uses the offset to determine where to continue after a deliberate or unexpected stop. As JDBC Consumer reads, it updates the offset value internally. When the pipeline stops, JDBC Consumer notes where it stopped reading data. When you restart the pipeline, it continues from the last-saved offset by default. You can reset the origin to use the initial offset value.
To reduce the chance of duplicate reads, use a primary key or index column for the offset column and include the offset column in an ORDER BY clause.
